content: #arcoprojectbag arco project bag about this drawstring bag can be used to keep your wips safe or for any other purpose the pattern features 3 sizes different methods to create a drawstring and instructions to sew in a lining optional to keep small items from falling out sizes 1 2 3 measurements 20 25 30 cm square when finished needles 3 75 mm circular needles 60 cm for size 1 and 2 80 cm for size 3 gauge the gauge in stockinette stitch is 19 5 st x 28 row materials the yarn used for the bag is drops bomull-lin you need the following weight of yarn to knit the bag 100 100 150 g which corresponds to the following length 170 170 255 m © anne hids 2023 v1 #arcoprojectbag in addition you need the following next round k1 yo k2tog k 33 43 53 k2tog yo k2 yo k2tog k33 k2tog yo k1 1 removable stitch marker 1 stitch marker for bor k 3 rounds safety pin folded edge scissors now we will knit the folded edge to knit the folded edge we will knit 3 5 mm crochet hook or 2 3 5 mm dpns or 120 - … cm of ribbon every stitch together with the corresponding loops of the cast-on edge as for drawstring follows optional a piece of cotton fabric to line the bag needle thread first carefully check which of the loops of the cast-on edge correspond to abbreviations the first stitch on the needle place a removable marker in these loops if k = knit that makes it easier for you only for the first stitch yo = yarn over k2tog = knit two together now insert the right needle into the first stitch on the left needle as if to st = stitch knit then insert it in the two corresponding loops of the cast-on edge bobble = bind off knit these three loops together repeat this for every stitch on the co = cast on needle the whole round should now be folded with the stockinette bor = beginning of round stitches on the outside body construction keep knitting in the round until the bag measures 21 26 31 cm from the the bag is worked from the top down which means the folded edge is top fold of the bag knitted first including the holes for the drawstrings then the bag is worked down and finally closed using the 3-needle bind-off three needle bind-off turn the bag inside out so that the purl bumps are on the outside hold pattern the two needles in your left hand so that the bag is folded cast on 78 98 118 stitches using the long tail cast-on join for knitting in taking your third needle in your right hand insert the third needle into the round while being careful not to twist any stitches place a marker for the first loop on both needles in your left hand knit these two loops
